thread.title: Anjana Sukhani is Bhansali's new heroine
thread.title_full: Anjana Sukhani is Bhansali's new heroine - The Times of India

author: Mihir Bhanage
title: Anjana Sukhani is Bhansali's new heroine
text:
Huma Qureshi and Tisca Chopra made their debuts with Highway and now actress Anjana Sukhani is set to join the bandwagon of Bollywood actresses jumping into Marathi films.
Anjana, who is known for her roles in 'Salam-E-Ishq' and 'Golmaal Returns', will be making her Marathi debut opposite Swwapnil Joshi in an upcoming Marathi love story. The film, being directed by Swapna Waghmare-Joshi, is also the first Marathi production from Sanjay Leela Bhansali and Shabina Khan .
When contacted, Anjana said, "It just took a call from the production house and I was on board. I have been educated in Mumbai and am familiar with Marathi. Though I don't speak it that well, everyone on the set here is helping me with it."It's been just a few days since the shooting started at Lonavala and the team is tight-lipped about the film's story. "Yes, it's a love story; an illogical love story for that matter. But beyond that, it's too early to reveal anything," informed Swapna, who has earlier directed Swwapnil in 'Mitwaa'.
Interestingly, it will also be a fresh pairing for Swwapnil's fans who've been seeing him paired with Sai Tamhankar in many of his recent romantic films. "Anjana and Swwapnil's chemistry is amazing and that's the high point of our film," Swapna added.
